opportunities.name: Humane Society of Stillwater
opportunities.description: Volunteers can walk dogs, socialize with cats, sweep and mop laundry areas, wash dog water bowls, pick up play yards, mow the lawn, and spot check and clean animal cages.

opportunities.name: Tiny Paws Kitten Rescue
opportunities.description: This organization is dedicated to the care and rescue of kittens.

opportunities.name: Turning Point Therapeutic Horsemanship
opportunities.description: Facilitate people's emotional, physical and behavioral health through therapeutic horsemanship and equine-assisted activities.

opportunities.name: Big Brothers Big Sisters of Oklahoma - Stillwater
opportunities.description: Become a one-on-one mentor to a child with a commitment of as little as 1 hour a week, or 2-4 hours a month, over a year of service.

opportunities.name: CASA for Kids, Inc.
opportunities.description: Provide a voice for abused or neglected children by advocating for them in court.

opportunities.name: Girl Scouts of Eastern Oklahoma
opportunities.description: Become a troop leader or assist with a program to help girls grow confident and strong. Volunteers must be 18 or older.

opportunities.name: Stillwater Literacy Council
opportunities.description: Tutor basic literacy students and individuals whose second language is English. Does not accept volunteers under 18 or groups.

opportunities.name: The Salvation Army of Stillwater: Family Store
opportunities.description: Assist with customers, take donations, and sort clothing at the family thrift store.

opportunities.name: Thrifty Butterfly
opportunities.description: Assist customers, and sort and process donations at the retail shop.

opportunities.name: Karman Korner Resale Shop
opportunities.description: Sort donations, steam and prepare garments for sale, price merchandise, create displays, and operate the cash register.

opportunities.name: Stillwater Mobile Meals
opportunities.description: Pack and deliver lunches to elderly, convalescing, and homebound residents of Stillwater, Monday through Friday.

opportunities.name: Our Daily Bread
opportunities.description: Welcome, serve, and connect with guests as they shop, sort through donations, restock shelves, or help in the community garden.

opportunities.name: 4 Kids and Community
opportunities.description: Help prepare food boxes and assist with monthly community suppers.

opportunities.name: The Salvation Army of Stillwater
opportunities.description: Help process donations, assist with the food pantry, or support the Shield on Wheels program.

opportunities.name: Mission of Hope
opportunities.description: Prepare meals, assist with cleaning and organizing, help clients, and stock shelves at the shelter. Does not offer hours for individuals under 18.

opportunities.name: Payne County Youth Services
opportunities.description: Work directly with children and youth, serve on boards, provide tutoring, assist with events and fundraising, and advocate for abused and neglected children.

opportunities.name: Wings of Hope Family Crisis Services
opportunities.description: Provide office work or cleaning for the shelter, offer on-site childcare for clients, or help sort donations at the retail shop.

opportunities.name: Stillwater Medical Volunteer Program
opportunities.description: Opportunities include knitting baby caps, gift shop customer service, providing comfort to patients, transporting patients, clerical duties, and delivering items.

opportunities.name: Karman Legacy Hospice Volunteer Program
opportunities.description: Provide companionship for patients, caregiver respite, administrative office work, deliver and arrange flowers, attend funerals, and create care packages.

opportunities.name: Stillwater Habitat for Humanity
opportunities.description: Help with construction projects, process donations for the resale shop, assist with recycling, or perform office work.

opportunities.name: Our Blood Institute
opportunities.description: Greet and thank donors at community blood drives, which are held 7 days a week at various locations. Does not offer hours for court-ordered community service.

opportunities.name: Lake McMurtry Friends
opportunities.description: Assist with special events, office work, trail maintenance, and cleanup days at Lake McMurtry.

opportunities.name: Lake Carl Blackwell
opportunities.description: Perform trail maintenance or building, pick up debris/trash from shorelines, clean fire pits in camping areas, and help with general lake upkeep.

opportunities.name: 4 Kids and Community
opportunities.description: Assist with monthly community suppers and help prepare food boxes.

opportunities.name: Girl Scouts of Eastern Oklahoma
opportunities.description: Become a troop leader or assist with a program to help girls grow confident and strong! Does not accept volunteers under 18 years old.

opportunities.name: Girl Scouts of Eastern Oklahoma
opportunities.description: Become a troop leader or assist with a program to help girls grow confident and strong! Does not accept volunteers under 18 years old.

opportunities.name: Cushing Pride
opportunities.description: Join the community in helping beautify the streets of Cushing and/or assist with recycling every other Sunday.

opportunities.name: Humane Society of Stillwater
opportunities.description: Walk dogs, socialize with cats, clean animal cages, and maintain facilities. This organization accepts court-ordered community service.

opportunities.name: Our Daily Bread
opportunities.description: Welcome and serve guests, sort donations, restock shelves, or help in the community garden. Accepts court-ordered community service, excluding violent crime convictions.

opportunities.name: Stillwater Public Library
opportunities.description: Dust bookshelves, alphabetize children's books, clean library grounds, prepare for programs, or assist with data entry. Accepts court-ordered community service, excluding theft or assault charges.

opportunities.name: Stillwater Group Homes
opportunities.description: Assist with administrative tasks, events, fundraising, communications, or programs. This organization accepts court-ordered community service.

opportunities.name: American Red Cross - Northern Oklahoma Chapter
opportunities.description: Assist with local and national disaster response, community preparedness programs, organize blood drives, support military families, and fundraising. Accepts volunteers 17 and under.

opportunities.name: Our Blood Institute
opportunities.description: Greet and thank donors at community blood drives. Accepts volunteers 17 and under, but not for court-ordered community service.

opportunities.name: First United Methodist Church
opportunities.description: Opportunities include Hope House (gathering supplies for foster families), Weekend Childrenâ€™s Food Sacks, and Shower Ministry on Thursdays. Accepts volunteers 17 and under.

opportunities.name: Lake McMurtry Friends
opportunities.description: Assist with special events, office work, trail maintenance, and cleanup days at Lake McMurtry. Accepts volunteers 17 and under.
